title: Campaigning for Social Change: Understanding the motives and experiences of people with dementia
abstractText: In recent years men and women with dementia have begun to campaign for increased public awareness and better services. The central aim of this two year study is to discover what motivates people with dementia to campaign. A further aim is to determine what impact such actions have on an individual, particularly in regard to their sense of citizenship. The study will take an ethnographic approach and use diary-interview method. Qualitative data will be collected from approximately twenty-five UK based campaigners in three phases. Phase one will involve talking to participants either individually or in groups about campaigning; phase two will involve asking participants to keep either a written, audio or photo diary about their campaign activities, during this phase the researcher will observe and photograph participants 'in action' at campaign events; the third phase will involve the researcher revisiting and talking to individuals about their diary entries.  Findings from the research will be fedback to participants and other invited guests at a public event. In addition, three academic papers will be written with a view to contributing to knowledge and public policy on civic participation.
